column4: Nope.  It's binary-only (closed source) and they haven't released a 64bit version.  The only thing you can use is a free alternative, like gnash, or something like gstreamer0.8-swfdec

needhelp1: no, that's the wrong way to go about "cleaning" your grub menu.  If you want those entries gone, just use your favorite package manager to remove their corresponding kernel packages (linux-image-[version])
find your linux-image- packages, and remove the old ones.  I recommend keeping at least one old, known good one.  In case you find a problem with the most recent kernel
